alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 11:49PM PST until January 13 at 3:08PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain over the central Cascades has come to a stop. The river is cresting near flood stage tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snohomish River Near Monroe. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, the Snohomish River will cause minor flooding of low pasture lands and several roads near the river. A stage of 15 feet at this location corresponds to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood Warning System. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM PST Wednesday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting near flood stage tonight and will slowly recede early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 01/19/1971. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 800 AM PST.
